channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Watch For in France’s High-Stakes Elections
item.description: French voters are heading to the polls after President Emmanuel Macron called for unexpected parliamentary elections that could put the country on a new course.

item.title: In the Basque Country, Muted Cheers for Spain’s Soccer Team
item.description: The region has long seen itself as distinct from its country and disinterested in the national team. Can a Euro 2024 squad studded with Basque stars turn heads?

item.title: The shocking $4.7 billion ruling against the NFL could disrupt the balance of power between the league and its teams
item.description: The NFL has kept its members happy by signing massive TV deals that makes everyone rich.

item.title: Beryl, the Season’s First Hurricane, Is Expected to Intensify
item.description: The hurricane is expected to intensify quickly and bring significant storm surge to the Windward Islands as a major hurricane, forecasters said on Saturday.

item.title: What to Watch For in France’s High-Stakes Elections
item.description: French voters are heading to the polls after President Emmanuel Macron called for unexpected parliamentary elections that could put the country on a new course.

item.title: A loophole in U.S. tariffs on Chinese EVs has allowed a flood of golf cart imports, and domestic producers are asking Biden for help
item.description: “Chinese import volumes have rapidly increased, taking greater consumer vehicle market share while using price benefits from Chinese government subsidies to drive their advantage.”

item.title: 13-Year-Old Boy Shot and Killed by Police After Chase
item.description: Officers in Utica, N.Y., believed the boy had brandished a handgun. The police chief said on Saturday that it was a pellet gun.

item.title: Beryl, the Season’s First Hurricane, Is Expected to Intensify
item.description: The hurricane is expected to intensify quickly and bring significant storm surge to the Windward Islands as a major hurricane, forecasters said on Saturday.

item.title: The owner of Redbox DVD kiosks just filed for bankruptcy, saying results ‘failed to meet management’s expectations’
item.description: Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment—the seller of self-help books, film and television content—filed for Chapter 11 protection in Delaware late Friday.

item.title: Why Do India and China Keep Fighting Over This Desolate Terrain?
item.description: Long-running battles in the Himalayas may foretell a more dangerous conflict.

item.title: Reformist Masoud Pezeshkian Reaches Runoff in Iran’s Presidential Election
item.description: Candidates in the campaign to fill the seat of President Ebrahim Raisi, who died in a helicopter crash, showed notable candor about the country’s mounting problems.

item.title: Astronauts aren’t stranded on the space station, NASA says, while troubleshooting on Boeing’s Starliner capsule continues
item.description: It's now three weeks and counting for Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams as NASA and Boeing troubleshoot equipment problems.

item.title: The Ghastly vs. the Ghostly
item.description: Do the Democrats really want to stop Trump? What are they prepared to do?

item.title: Motorcycles and Mayhem in Ukraine’s East
item.description: In the latest tactic for storming trenches, Russians use motorcycles and dune buggies to speed across open space, often into a hail of gunfire.

item.title: Execs should urge workers to return to the office to help San Francisco, Fed president says
item.description: "Talk about what you need to fix and also encourage your people to come back to work," San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said.
